text.section: A gaming event may be conducted only by a fundraising organization that has been located in the county for at least 5 years before applying for a gaming permit.
A fundraising organization shall obtain a gaming permit for each gaming event that the fundraising organization conducts.

section.section: At least 30 days before the first day of the calendar quarter in which the gaming event is to be conducted, a fundraising organization seeking a gaming permit shall submit to the board an application and the application fee.
A principal officer of the fundraising organization shall sign and verify the application under the penalties of perjury.

text.section: The county commissioners may set a reasonable application fee for a gaming permit.

section.section:
The board shall:
review the gaming permit applications for a calendar quarter within 10 days after the application deadline set in subsection (c)(1) of this section;
recommend approval or denial of each application; and
promptly forward the applications and recommendations to the county commissioners.
This section does not prevent the board or the county commissioners from reviewing gaming permit applications more frequently or earlier than required by this subsection.
